intro: Fissistigma maccreae, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen perennial, often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Its unique floral structure attracts various pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance.
